Event.0:
Eruption of Mount Vesuvius
Mount Vesuvius in Italy erupted on this day in 79 , destroying the ancient cities of Pompeii and Herculaneum, and the excavations of these sites in the mid-18th century precipitated the modern science of archaeology.
Event.1: Mt Vesuvius erupts, buries Roman Pompeii and Herculaneum, 15,000 die
Event.2: Rome overrun by Visigoths under Alaric I for the first time in nearly 800 years, seen as the fall of the Western Roman Empire
Event.3: Alaric, chief of the Visigoths, led an army into Rome, an event that symbolizes the fall of the Western Roman Empire.
Event.4: American actor Eddie Cibrian (36) divorces TV personality Brandi Glanville (35) due to irreconcilable differences
Event.5: Summer Olympics in Beijing becomes the most watched event on TV ever - nearly 5 billion, 70% of world's population
Event.6: Pluto was demoted from planet to dwarf planet after the International Astronomical Union approved a reclassification of the solar system.
Event.7: Actress Zsa Zsa Gabor (59) divorces her sixth husband, toy inventor Jack Ryan (49) after 1 year of marriage
Event.8:
Dave Chappelle
American comedian and actor
was born
Event.9: Actor Peter Sellers (44) weds model Miranda Quarry
Event.10: France becomes the world's fifth thermonuclear power with a detonation on Mururoa Atoll in the South Pacific
Event.11: 24th Venice Film Festival: "Hands Over the City" directed by Francesco Rosi wins Golden Lion
Event.12:
Stephen Fry
British actor, writer, and director
was born
Event.13:
Mike Huckabee
American politician
was born
Event.14: The North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) entered into force, following the signing of its treaty four months earlier.
Event.15:
Paulo Coelho
Brazilian author
was born
Event.16:
Vince McMahon
American businessman
was born
Event.17: Businessman James Cash Penney (24) weds Bertha Alva Hess
Event.18: The Treaty of Córdoba was signed, giving Mexico its independence from Spain.
Event.19: During the War of 1812, British forces captured Washington, D.C., and burned various government buildings, notably the Capitol and the Executive Mansion (now known as the White House).
Event.20: British forces capture Washington, D.C. and destroy many landmarks (War of 1812)
Event.21: Irish revolutionary James Napper Tandy died in France.
Event.22: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart completes his violin and piano sonata in A, K526
Event.23: Act of Uniformity requires English to accept Book of Common Prayer
Event.24: St. Bartholomew's Day Massacre of Protestants by Roman Catholics begins in Paris and later spreads to the French provinces
Event.25: The Massacre of St. Bartholomew's Day, plotted by Catherine de Médicis against the French Huguenots, was carried out by Roman Catholic nobles and other citizens.
Event.26: Willem of Orange marries duchess Anna of Saxon
Event.27: Battle of Marj Dabiq: Ottoman forces decisively beat the Mamluk Sultanate
